intro: Phyllanthus inaequifolius, commonly known as the unequal-leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, asymmetrical leaves that vary in size and shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
